members.member:
The Api class is the main interaction class between eWebReports and the host application. All API session parameters are accessed through this class. An Api object should be the first thing that is created to interact with eWebReports.
EX-9487: Autotask requires SessionInfo to be CLS-Compliant. Also added the attribute to the Api class since it is the main entry point for interaction with Exago.

member.name: M:WebReports.Api.Api.#ctor
member.summary: Initialize the API object, this is for internal use only.

member.name: M:WebReports.Api.Api.#ctor(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Initialize the API object with the provided configuration and sets the application virtual path.
member.param: The virtual path to the eWebReports application.
Optional file name (default is WebReports.xml) of the configuration to use, this file name must exist in the eWebReports config directory or cloud storage.
Optional connection string for location of configuration files storage. Defaults to Config folder if value is null.

member.name: M:WebReports.Api.Api.#ctor(System.String,System.Boolean,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Initialize the API object with the provided configuration and sets the application virtual path.
member.param: The virtual path to the eWebReports application.
Set to true if your application uses Apache log4net. If set to false, Exago will configure log4net itself which may cause problems with application logging.
Optional file name (default is WebReports.xml) of the configuration to use, this file name must exist in the eWebReports config directory or cloud storage.
Optional connection string for location of configuration files storage. Defaults to Config folder if value is null.

member.name: P:WebReports.Api.Api.ApiKey
member.summary:
NOTE: When establishing an API instance for a user, GetApiKey (JS embedding) or GetUrlParamString (iframe embedding) must be called in order to persist that user's effective configuration to disk. This getter is provided as a convenience to retrive the current API key after calling one of those functions.
Returns the unique API key for the current Exago API instance.

member.name: T:WebReports.Api.Common.SystemAudit
member.summary: Given the SQLite database file name, this is a common means of both writing to and extracting from the given Monitoring database.

member.name: M:WebReports.Api.Common.SystemAudit.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: SystemAudit constructor
member.param: The fully qualified filesystem file name of the SQLite database file.

member.name: M:WebReports.Api.Common.SystemAudit.Initialize(System.String)
member.summary: Initialize the Monitoring database, given the SQLite database file name
member.param: The fully qualified filesystem file name of the SQLite database file.
member.exception: Thrown if the given SQLite database file doesn't exist.

member.name: M:WebReports.Api.Common.SystemAudit.Audit(WebReports.Api.Common.ExecutionAuditObject)
member.summary: Means to save Audit data to the pre-configured SQLite Monitoring database for the specfic ExecutionAuditObject overload. By requiring ExecutionAuditObject input, the expected data is specific to saving the data to multiple - ReportAudit and ExecutionDetails - Monitoring database tables.
member.param: ExecutionAuditObject is the complete data necessary to save Execution Audit information to the db
member.returns: auditId from the "begin" insert so it can be provided back to a separate call to this method when inserting the "end" transaction; auditId returned from an "end" transaction is irrelevant

member.name: M:WebReports.Api.Common.SystemAudit.Audit(WebReports.Api.Common.GenericReportAuditObject)
member.summary: Means to save Audit data to the pre-configured SQLite Monitoring database for the specfic GenericReportAuditObject overload. By requiring GenericReportAuditObject input, the expected data is specific to saving the data to the appropriate Monitoring database tables.
member.param: GenericReportAuditObject is the complete data necessary to save "generic" (currently non-execution audit) information to the db
member.returns: long value indicating success (0) or failure (1) of the save to database

member.name: M:WebReports.Api.Common.SystemAudit.Audit(WebReports.Api.Common.NonReportAuditObject)
member.summary: Means to save Audit data to the pre-configured SQLite Monitoring database for the specfic NonReportAuditObject overload. By requiring NonReportAuditObject input, the expected data is specific to saving the data to the appropriate Monitoring database tables.
member.param: NonReportAuditObject is the complete data necessary to save non-report information to the db
member.returns: long value indicating success (0) or failure (1) of the save to database

member.name: M:WebReports.Api.Common.SystemAudit.Extract
member.summary: After data has been saved to the local, pre-configured Monitoring databases via the Audit methods above, this method can be used to Extract that information. It is expected that it will be subsequently saved to a central database for downstream reporting purposes.
member.returns: a Dictionary<string, DataSet> object containing one or more keys and associated DataSets

member.name: M:WebReports.Api.Common.SystemAudit.CreateStatisticsDict(System.String,System.Double,System.Double,System.String)
member.summary: Scheduler server statistics are not collected from a local database table. Instead, they are collected real-time and saved in a DataSet such that the data can be handled in the same way that data retrieved from a database is handled. Given the appropriate data, this method generates the data structure necessary for Scheduler server statistics.
member.param: The name of the host.
The percent of CPU available for processing.
The amount of unused RAM.
The timestamp representing when the data was collected.
member.returns: Dictionary<string, DataSet> object containing provided information and arranged specifically for downstream consumption.

member.name: T:WebReports.Api.Common.ExecutionAuditObject
member.summary: An overloaded Object containing data specific to handling data associated with auditing report executions. This object is specifically-shaped to help define which Audit method will process the data.

member.name: T:WebReports.Api.Common.GenericReportAuditObject
member.summary: An overloaded Object containing data specific to handling data associated with auditing report component usage. This object is specifically-shaped to help define which Audit method will process the data.

member.name: T:WebReports.Api.Common.NonReportAuditObject
member.summary: An overloaded Object containing data specific to handling data associated with auditing non-report component usage. This object is specifically-shaped to help define which Audit method will process the data.

member.name: T:WebReports.Api.Common.AuditTransactionType
member.summary: This is a glorified enum with the added benefit of providing a string-based value that can be used in database inserts. These constitute what is currently collected as Audit data. Each object can be configured via appsettings as to whether or not the item is collected/audited. If not configured, however, any given item will be collected/audited by default.

member.name: T:WebReports.Api.Common.AuditConfig
member.summary: Helper class supporting AuditTransactionType. Consists of an transaction type name and a boolean indicating whether said transaction type is collected/audited.

member.name: M:WebReports.Api.Common.UdfFunction.DisplayHtml(WebReports.Api.Common.PageInfo)
member.summary: Provide a translated Html Description string according to this scheme: find a translation for the Name. (using the special wrFunctionId suffix) if there is no Name translation, see if there is a Description if there's no Description, use that (translated) function name. The Description translation Id is the text itself. if there is one, use that (translated) description. By default, the built in functions - which all have translations - will have no descriptions, so that they can be changed by an admin if needed.
member.returns: HTML-safe description for Display

member.summary: Retrives an entity by it's Name or Id property
member.param: The identifier by which to get the Entity (either the entity's Name or Id, based on the getById parameter)
If true, Entitys who's Id property match identifier are returned, else Entitys who's Name property match identifier are returned
If true and identifier contains at least one dot ('.') character, only the portion of identifier before the first dot is used to find the Entity

member.name: M:WebReports.Api.Common.EntityCollection.ShouldAlias(WebReports.Api.Reports.Entity,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Indicate whether an Entity name needs to be aliased Only needs to be aliased if there is a prior one in the collection with the same dbname on the same datasource See note on keeping this private in comments for GetDataObjectAliasName below.

members.member:
Returns a generic aliased data object name
IMPORTANT: We always want external callers to access this method by entityName (and not pass an actual Entity) becaue of the mismatch between SetupData.Entities and Report.Entities. Since we use indexing here, an Entity passed from e.g. SetupData (as in Sort.Entity) will return an index of -1 in Report.Entities. [EX-9901] If we want an alias use its name unless this feature is suppressed and we use the old wrEindex construct

Determines whether or not the name should be aliased and returns the appropriate string
IMPORTANT: We always want external callers to access this method by entityName (and not pass an actual Entity) becaue of the mismatch between SetupData.Entities and Report.Entities. Since we use indexing here, an Entity passed from e.g. SetupData (as in Sort.Entity) will return an index of -1 in Report.Entities.

member.name: M:WebReports.Api.Common.EntityCollection.GetDataObjectNameForSql(WebReports.Api.Reports.Entity,System.Char[],System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: IMPORTANT: This method should remain private. We want external callers to call by Entityname using the method above due to the possible mismatch of Entities between setup data and report entities. We will often get SQL Aliasing errors if an Entity from setup data is passed directly here and we search for the entity in the report collection. WHen passing by name we ensure we retrieve the proper entity from the collection when checking alias-ness and grabbing the alias index

Returns a new Graph loaded from a test input file. This function is used for unit-testing the Graph class. Test input files should look like this: a b c // Space-separated list of node names a b -1 // Edge definition (space-separated fromnode, tonode, integer weight) a c -2
Test files may contain zero edges, in which case the file will contain only one line, the list of nodes. There must be at least one node in the graph.

member.name: M:WebReports.Api.Data.DataObjectBase.ConsolidateTypeForComparison(System.IComparable,System.IComparable,System.IComparable@,System.IComparable@,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Takes two elements that do not match in terms of type and attempts to match the types. First, if one of the elements is null(stored as empty string), it will match the null to the other value's type If neither value is null, the left type is matched to the right's type. Failing that, both values are converted to strings to avoid throwing an error. Extended fix for EX-8439. Intended to fix errors thrown by 1037's element1.CompareTo(element2) by guaranteeing both elements are of the same type.
member.returns: type matched IComparable leftElement, type matched IComparable rightElement

member.name: M:WebReports.Api.Data.DataObjectBase.ConsolidateNullType(System.IComparable,System.Type)
member.summary: Used to consolidate types between 2 Icomparables when their "null" values don't match in data type. **** Changes LEFT to match RIGHT's Type.******* "Nulls" are converted to "", thus CompareTo will throw error if comparing "" to a Non-Null, non-string value. See EX-8439 NOTE: This is may allow some weirdness to come through that I didn't think of. As far as I can see stuff like: if(somecondition,Null(),0) seem to work fine.
member.returns: nullElement

member.name: M:WebReports.Api.Export.PdfRtfBaseExporter.CheckHeaderFooterCells(WebReports.Api.Reports.Cell[0:,0:])
member.summary: WARNING: this is a bit of a hack and only supports certain formats for the page number Scan the cell array being used as a header for page number tokens We allow anything that matches the regex, basically a string concatinated to a page number token Two properties of the Cell object are used: isPageNumberChecked and pageNumberPrefix Note that we are actually checking the cell's ExecuteReportCell which is the original cell from the report, the current cell object has already been processed for display. THe problem with PDF and RTF is that the page number is not correct at the time the cell was processed. If the ExecuteReportCell contains a string we understand then we tag the cell by setting its pageNumberPrefix and this will later be used to generate a pagenumber cell

member.name: T:WebReports.Api.ExpressView.ExpressViewConverterOptions
member.summary: Options for ExpressViewConverter.ConvertToAdvancedReport

member.name: F:WebReports.Api.ExpressView.ExpressViewConverterOptions.IncludeAllAggTypes
member.summary: If true, adds a group/report footer row for every aggregate type. This is used in the ExpressView designer to pre-calculate all aggregates so the user can switch agg types without going a server callback. If false, only aggcount is added to the report and group footers.

member.name: F:WebReports.Api.ExpressView.ExpressViewConverterOptions.IncludePageHeader
member.summary: If true, adds a page header containing column header text

member.name: F:WebReports.Api.ExpressView.ExpressViewConverterOptions.IncludeTotalsText
member.summary: If true, includes descriptive text for totals eg. "Report totals," "Total for OrderId"

member.name: F:WebReports.Api.ExpressView.ExpressViewConverterOptions.FlattenGroups
member.summary: If false, report headers/footers and group headers/footers are not included in the converted report

member.name: F:WebReports.Api.ExpressView.ExpressViewConverterOptions.IncludeColumnHeaderText
member.summary: If true, column titles will be added as the last row of the last group header

member.name: F:WebReports.Api.ExpressView.ExpressViewConverterOptions.PadSectionsWithBlankRows
member.summary: If true, some sections will be separated using a blank row to make the report output more easily readable

member.name: F:WebReports.Api.ExpressView.ExpressViewConverterOptions.UseGroupColors
member.summary: If true, colors will be used to identify nested groupings and detail headers

member.name: F:WebReports.Api.ExpressView.ExpressViewConverterOptions.UseInvariantDataFormats
member.summary: If true, data cell formats will be set to "Text." This is used in the ExpressView designer where we want to always pass the culture-invariant-format data to the client so all formatting can happen there.

member.name: F:WebReports.Api.ExpressView.ExpressView.SingleCategoryId
member.summary: If the ExpressView was designed with the Admin Console "Limit Reports and Visualizations to One Category" flag set to true, this represents the ID of the category from which all entities on the report should be drawn. This is used for "multiple data models" like Autotask uses (see "Multiple Data Models" in the Exago tech guide). If the report was designed with the "Limit Reports and Visualizations to One Category" flag set to false, this field will be null, indicating that the "multiple data models" logic will not be used.

member.name: F:WebReports.Api.ExpressView.ExpressView.AllFilters
member.summary: A list of filters, all of which must be true for a record to pass (These filters are ANDed together during execution). The AllFilters collection is ANDed with the AnyFilters collection to make the full filters collection when the ExpressView is converted to a standard report for execution.

member.name: F:WebReports.Api.ExpressView.ExpressView.AnyFilters
member.summary: A list of filters, any of which can be true for a record to pass (These filters are ORed together during execution. member.name: M:WebReports.Api.ReportMgmt.ReportMgmtBase.GetCachedReportList(System.String)
member.summary: Return the previous list if its still valid. We cache on the session id and the reportPath Use the abstract FillReportList() to get all the data when we need to refresh or load the cache This can be suppressed with the general setting IsReportListCacheEnabled NOTE: we are holding the lock on the cache while we fill it - should find a way to avoid that but somehow block other users that want the same element

member.name: M:WebReports.Api.ReportMgmt.ReportMgmtBase.ClearReportListCache
member.summary: Called by methods which change the list of reports and folders and thus invalidates the cache We invalidate all caches since we don't know how the changes will affect any particular user

member.name: M:WebReports.Api.ReportMgmt.ReportMgmtFileSystem.GetReportType(System.String,System.String)
member.summary:
Search for a report file in order to determine the type of report
The reportName is assumed to not have an extension. Note: the reportName may contain a period We search for all the possible report files by appending the legal extentions. If that fails to find a file we test for the possibility that the name contained extensions. If removing that extension would have found the file we throw an exception
Normally simple return NULL for no report found
member.param: Name of the report, prefixed with relative directory but no standard extension
ignored

member.name: T:WebReports.Api.Reports.WidgetCellReference
member.summary: The WidgetCellReference class represents a variable built by WidgetCellReferenceCollectionBuilder. Each WidgetCellReference variable keeps a queue of values. The queue is built up during the first pass and is consumed during the second pass. This building/consuming is controlled by the ProcessSectionForSave and ProcessSectionForRead functions. It is important that the sections are processed in the same order both times, otherwise values will become unpredictable and/or errors may occur. Each "value" in the queue is actually a list of values to be consumed by a widget in ReportExecutionData; there is one value entry built per widget instance.

member.name: T:WebReports.Api.Reports.WidgetCellReference.WidgetCellReferenceValueProvider
member.summary: This is an internal class used to provide the data for calculating the value of this referenced cell. We can't use the normal mechanisms to obtain the value because cell references must be 100% evaluatable at any time (forward references). The first pass builds a queue of these WidgetCellReferenceValueProvider objects, the second pass uses them to derive the value of the cell reference.

member.name: T:WebReports.Api.Reports.WidgetCellReferenceCollectionBuilder
member.summary: A WidgetCellReferenceCollectionBuilder is a CellVariableCollection that builds a collection of WidgetCellReferences, which provide data to widgets during the second pass of execution. Unlike other CelLVariableCollectionBuilders, this class does not parse cell text to find instances of a certain variable type, it checks to see if the cell is referred to by a widget, then if it is, adds it to the collection. This collection builder creates WidgetCellReference objects (which extends CellVariable)

member.returns: A list of Cell objects that are being referred to by the widget cell

member.name: T:WebReports.Api.Reports.ReportObjectFactory
member.summary:
ReportObjectFactory is the entry point to application report manipulation. This factory manages access to reports via API, updating schedules on certain actions (rename, delete), and creation of new reports. This functionality essentially sits on top of ReportMgmtBase and ReportScheduler allowing the exploiter a cleaner API for report management within the application.
All reports in the application derive from the ReportObject object.

member.name: P:WebReports.Api.Reports.CellAggMethod.HasKeyFreeAggregate
member.summary: [EX-9755] This method supports the key-free bahavior for aggregates AggSum, AggAvg, AggCount, RunningSum, AggVariance, AggStandardDeviation, AggMedian, AggMode. Key-free behavior means to treat the data field values as a bag of values, which can include duplicates.

member.name: T:WebReports.Api.Reports.CellAggMethod_Count
member.summary: The Count aggregate function. This class will provide the aggregate count of the function provided (how many times this function was processed).

member.name: T:WebReports.Api.Reports.ReportCrossTabTabulationStyle
member.summary: A CrossTab tabulation style represents the unique style of a cross tabulation. The number of cross tabulation styles depends on the number of CrossTab row headers and column headers, and whether the headers of totals associated with them. Note the most granular tabulation style is not represented here, it is represented by ReportCrossTabTabulation.SourceCell. Note also that the last row header and last column header represents the "grand total" tabulation styles, this is similar to how totals are defined.

member.name: T:WebReports.Api.Reports.CellAggFunctionCollectionBuilder
member.summary:
A CellAggFunctionCollectionBuilder is an instance of a CellVariableCollection that is capable of parsing and tokenizing text containing aggregate functions. An aggregate function is a special function that aggregates data across multiple data rows (e.g. calculate the sum of sales for all customers). All aggregate functions contain one parameter which can itself be a formula. An aggregate function is one of the following:
* aggsum * aggmax * aggmin * aggavg * aggcount * aggdistinctcount * aggvariance * aggstandarddeviation * aggmedian * aggmode
This collection builder creates CellAggFunction objects (which extends CellVariable). A CellAggFunction object has a token that starts with 'vtok!:'.
Note it is necessary for all other CellVariableCollectionBuilder objects to build their collections first, since once this builder tokenizes a string all variables within the aggregate function's parameter are gone.

member.name: M:WebReports.Api.Reports.CellAggFunctionCollectionBuilder.#ctor(WebReports.Api.Common.PageInfo,WebReports.Api.Reports.CellVariableCollection)
member.summary: Create the CellAggFunctionCollectionBuilder object
member.param: The PageInfo object
The collection of variables that will contain any potential variables within an aggregate function parameter

member.name: M:WebReports.Api.Reports.CellFormulaHelper.PrepareFormulaText(System.String)
member.summary: Given a formula (starts with "="), prepare the formula for execution. This function does the following: * Removes irrelevant white spaces * Changes all case-insensitive text to lower-case for easy analysis and comparisons * Verifies (, {, [, @, and quotes are balanced * Verifies valid characters within a grouping ('(' and ')', '{' and '}', '[' and ']', and '@' and '@') * Replaces all functions which have alias names to a consistent invocation
member.param: The formula to prepare
member.returns: The prepared formula

member.name: M:WebReports.Api.Reports.CellFormulaHelper.ReplaceAliasFunctions(System.String)
member.summary: Replace all alias functions with their primary name
member.param: The formula text
member.returns: The replaced formula

member.summary: Clean the text. This does the following: * Removes irrelevant white spaces * Changes all case-insensitive text to lower-case for easy analysis and comparisons * Verifies (, {, [, @, and quotes are balanced * Verifies valid characters within a grouping ('(' and ')', '{' and '}', '[' and ']', and '@' and '@')
member.param: The formula text
member.returns: The cleansed formula

member.name: T:WebReports.Api.Reports.CellReference
member.summary: The CellReference class represents a variable built by CellReferenceCollectionBuilder. Each CellReference variable keeps a queue of values. The queue is built up during the first pass and is consumed during the second pass. This building/consuming is controlled by the ProcessSectionForSave and ProcessSectionForRead functions. It is important that the sections are processed in the same order both times, otherwise values will become unpredictable and/or errors may occur.

member.name: T:WebReports.Api.Reports.CellReference.CellReferenceValueProvider
member.summary: This is an internal class used to provide the data for calculating the value of this referenced cell. We can't use the normal mechanisms to obtain the value because cell references must be 100% evaluatable at any time (forward references). The first pass builds a queue of these CellReferenceValueProvider objects, the second pass uses them to derive the value of the cell reference.

This must be done in two steps because aggregates might reference a cell and they want the "current" value (what this gives us). member.name: P:WebReports.Api.Reports.EntityColumnMetadata.SortAndGroupByFormula
member.summary: Specifies the formula to use when sorting or grouping by the column. This allows for a separate display value and sort/group value for each field. The formula defined should not include a leading equals sign. Example: If you have Employee.FullName but want it to group by ={Employee.Id} when grouping by the field so each unique employee has their own group even if more than one employee shares the same name.

member.summary: Used to only return false for ExagoFormula type columns since we didn't used to be able to sort by formula. Now we can, but I'm keeping this getter as a stub in case we want to implement this as a switch in column metadata in the future.

member.name: P:WebReports.Api.Reports.Cell.ClientValue
member.summary: Gets the non-formatted value to send to the client. Our data could be a string representation of a date, in which case the client may want it to be treated as a date on the client if the cell format is set to General or Date. This property will attempt to parse a date string and return it in our invariant format so the client doesn't have to parse a fuzzy format.

member.name: M:WebReports.Api.Reports.Cell.GetClientValue(System.String)
member.summary: Gets the non-formatted value to send to the client. Our data could be a string representation of a number or date, in which case the client may want it to be treated as the actual data type on the client if the cell format is set to General, Number, or Date. This function will attempt to parse a decimal/date string and return it in our invariant format so the client doesn't have to parse a fuzzy format.

member.name: T:WebReports.Api.Reports.CellDataFieldCollectionBuilder
member.summary: A CellDataFieldCollectionBuilder is an instance of a CellVariableCollection that is capable of parsing and tokenizing text containing data fields. A data field is any text surrounded by '{' and '}' and references a specific column within a datasource object. This collection builder creates CellDataField objects (which extends CellVariable). A CellDataField object has a token that starts with 'vtok!:'.

member.name: F:WebReports.Api.Reports.Entity.IsParameterEntity
member.summary: This is used to distinguish between filter dropdown objects tied to another entity, and parameter dropdown objects which share a lot of common code with filter dropdown objects, but exist as full entities of their own. This should only be called when dynamically creating an entity for use as a parameter dropdown object, and should not be used to modify existing entities.

member.name: M:WebReports.Api.Reports.Report.CreateJoins
member.summary: Update the collection of JOINs for the existing entities We create a set of JOINs using the system level JOIN information for all entities in the report. If there is already a JOIN for that set of entities then we'll use the existing specification as there maybe custom options. Any unused existing JOIN is tested to see if both its entities still exist and if so we retain it. [EX-8881] Make sure we keep custom JOINs

member.name: M:WebReports.Api.Reports.Report.IntegrateJoins(WebReports.Api.Reports.ReportJoinCollection)
member.summary: Integrate dynamically created Joins with the existing set of (possibly custom) Joins this.Joins contains the Joins we loaded the parameter buildJoins are produced by examining the entities in the report and the global Joins available. We will override the use of a global join if a custom one exists in the local join collection

The text that controls how the sort works. Can be a field name ("Employees.LastName") or a formula starting with an equals sign ("={Employees.FirstName} & " " & {Employees.LastName}").

member.name: M:WebReports.Api.Scheduler.Config.GetSmtpClient
member.summary: Return a configured SmtpClient. Returns NULL if configuration items are not correctly defined. If the Userid or password are not provided then default credentials is implied if the UserId is set to 'NoSmtpCredentials' and the Password is set to some non-empty value then we set EnableSsl to false and assume no credentials are required note: added smtp server port capability by using host:port syntax in Config.SmtpServer

member.name: M:WebReports.Api.Scheduler.Config.Initialize
member.summary: Initialize the configuration. This should be called by the startup code with no threads running
member.remarks: Find our configuration file. First look into the registry HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE/Software/Exago/eWebReportsScheduler/ConfigFile If its not found there then see if anything is specified in our exe Config file Otherwise we default to eWebReportsScheduler.xml in the same directory as the executable

member.name: M:WebReports.Api.Scheduler.IReportSchedulerObject.GetSystemResourceValue(System.Version)
member.summary: This function returns two values. The first being an available resource value, and the second the percent of available job slots 1 / (active jobs vs max jobs) The resource value is a number between 0-1 representing resource availability. Dictates whether the intention is to collect statistics only or both statistics and report execution details.

member.name: M:WebReports.Api.SqlUtils.DbSqlHandler.Clear
member.summary: In an effort to reuse a SQLHandler object, this method allows for clearning out a previous SQL statement so that it can be used again.

member.name: M:WebReports.Api.SqlUtils.DbSqlHandler.InitConnection
member.summary: Initialize the connection to the database. Connection string lives in the main project's web.config via standard configuration.If SqlConnection is created successfully or pre-exists, open the connection.If failure of any sort, clean up the SqlConnection and re-throw the error to be managed at a higher level.

member.name: M:WebReports.Api.SqlUtils.DbSqlHandler.ExecuteNQCmd
member.summary: Executes a non-query SQL statement (meant for use with INSERT or UPDATE statements). There is an assumption that a Stmt and, possibly, this.SqlParams are set prior to calling this method. If not, an exception will be thrown.

member.name: M:WebReports.Api.SqlUtils.DbSqlHandler.ExecuteScalarCmd
member.summary: Executes a SQL query (meant for use with SELECT statements returning a single value). There is an assumption that a Stmt and, possibly, this.SqlParams are set prior to calling this method. If not, an exception will be thrown.
member.returns: The queried Object

member.name: M:WebReports.Api.SqlUtils.DbSqlHandler.ExecuteReadCmd
member.summary: Executes a SQL query (meant for use with SELECT statements returning a full DataSet object). There is an assumption that a Stmt and, possibly, this.SqlParams are set prior to calling this method. If not, an exception will be thrown.
member.returns: The resulting query's DataSet object

member.name: M:WebReports.Api.SqlUtils.DbSqlHandler.ExecTransaction
member.summary: Executes a series of SQL commands, which may be a mixture of INSERT, UPDATE, SELECT, or DELETE. In standard Transaction fashion, all changes will be committed or, if error, none will be. There is an assumption that SqlTxnCmds and, possibly, this.SqlParams objects are set prior to calling this method. If not, an exception will be thrown. Results of SQL commands will be saved back to SqlTxnCmds object for subsequent reference.
member.returns: List of SqlTxnObjects containing the results of each SQL statement in the transaction.

member.name: T:WebReports.Api.SqlUtils.SqlTxnObject
member.summary: Object used for processing multiple SQL statements in a transaction (which requires a specific order).

member.name: M:WebReports.Api.SqlUtils.SqlTxnObject.#ctor(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Constructor
member.param: A SQL statement.
Index for identification and ordering purposes.

members.member: This needs to be listed after "Advanced" so it will be used during a ToString() operation instead of "Advanced" This is to address a forward compatibility issue where advanced reports created in a newer version cannot be opened in an older version. Ths issue also affects opening and saving a pre-existing standard report without making any changes to the report itself. At some point in the future the order of these can be switched back so that "Advanced" will be saved to the report xml instead.

The position of the cursor

member.name: M:WebReports.Api.ExecuteData.ExecuteBreakField.AddBreakField(System.String)
member.summary: Add a new field to the list of break fields. The additional functionality was moved from IsBreak() which was performing this test everytime it was called and seems to be using a lot of CPU in the process. So now we do it only when adding the elements to the list. WARNING: We do have the list protected so it possible that other components might directly add things to the list. EX-9962

member.name: M:WebReports.Api.ExecuteData.ExecuteBreakField.CurrentBreakValue(WebReports.Api.ExecuteData.ExecuteDataTable)
member.summary: In some cases (single row in first group) IsBreak can't be used to extract the group value, so it needs to be done here instead.

member.name: T:WebReports.Api.ExecuteData.ExecuteDataTable.ExecuteDataMode
member.summary: Enumeration for controlling the way data is processed/saved/returned by the ExecuteReport and ExecuteDataTable classes

member.name: F:WebReports.Api.ExecuteData.ExecuteDataTable.ExecuteDataMode.Standard
member.summary: Indicates that the data should be treated as though this is a "normal" execution or re-execution. If the data file exists, it will be used, if not, it will be created from the data source.

member.name: F:WebReports.Api.ExecuteData.ExecuteDataTable.ExecuteDataMode.TopN
member.summary: TopN indicates that the data will be re-generated based on a tree containing an ordered/filtered set of data specific to the Top-N records meeting the user requirements. New data will not be read from the data source, nor will it be read unaltered from the existing intermediate file.

member.name: F:WebReports.Api.ExecuteData.ExecuteDataTable.ExecuteDataMode.Resume
member.summary: Resume indicates that any existing intermediate files will be appended with additional data pulled from the data source before returning the updated data table. The resulting table will be automatically "fast forwarded" to the beginning of the new data rows.

member.name: M:WebReports.Api.ExecuteData.ExecuteDataTable.ExecuteDataObjectToString(System.Object,System.Boolean,System.Int32,System.String)
member.summary: Converts an object from the execution DataTable to a string, with special handling for dates
member.param: The object from the DataTable
true if the object should be parsed as a DateTime string regardless of the column type
The value to return if is null
member.returns: A string representation

member.name: M:WebReports.Api.ExecuteData.ExecuteDataTable.FastForward(System.Int32)
member.summary: This method has the effect of moving the row pointer ahead by "rowNum" rows. This can be used to set the start point when called before any processing has begun.
member.param: Number of rows to increment the current pointer.

The execution object describing this execution.

member.name: M:WebReports.Api.ExecuteData.ExecuteDataBuilder.Execute
member.summary: Retrieve the data that is required. Note this is a very expensive function, this is the heavy hitter that will go out and query all required datasources, will combine any multi-data sources together, and will do any cartesian processing.
member.returns: A DataTable containing all the data, sorted and filtered appropriately. Each column is a relevant data field in Entity.ColumnName format

member.returns: The data builder object that is best suited for the entities provided.

member.name: M:WebReports.Api.Execute.ActiveLocalExecution.SetPercentage(System.Int32)
member.summary: Set the current percentage completion for the current phase, this should be called by the executing process.
member.param: The current percentage

member.name: M:WebReports.Api.Execute.ActiveLocalExecution.SetNumPages(System.Int32)
member.summary: Set the current number of pages written, this should be called by the executing process. While the client is polling for execution status, it receives this value for the number of pages that have finished being exported. EX-9962 we suppress this for every page for efficiencie as it turns out to be quite costly: 20% of total execution time for JSOM output but we don't update the internal page count until we save this to disk so that in a webfarm situation all servers will report the same number of pages.

member.name: T:WebReports.Api.Execute.ExecutionManager
member.summary: The execution manager manages all asyncronous report executions. This is a static class, all executions within the application can be accessed here.

member.name: M:WebReports.Api.Execute.ExecutionManager.ExecuteSync(WebReports.Api.Common.PageInfo,WebReports.Api.Execute.ActiveLocalExecution,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Execute the provided execution object syncronously (calling Execute.ExecuteSync). Calling this way allows you to retrieve the execution object (while it is executing) from another thread. This execution will always be done on the current thread even if remote execution is supported.
member.param: The PageInfo object.
The execute object, this is what will be executed synchronously
Whether this thread should be given low priority

member.name: M:WebReports.Api.Execute.ExecutionManager.ExecuteAsync(WebReports.Api.Common.PageInfo,WebReports.Api.Execute.ActiveLocalExecution,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Execute the provided execution object asyncronously (calling Execute.ExecuteAsync). Calling this way allows you to later retrieve the execution object (while it is executing). It also will handle converting a local execute to a remote execute if remote execution is enabled, in which case the Guid returned will identify a newly created RemoteExecute object.
member.param: The PageInfo object.
The execute object, this is what will be executed asyncronously
Whether the execution thread should be given low priority.

member.name: T:WebReports.Api.Execute.BaseExecution
member.summary: The execution object represents a currently executing process or an already executed process. This is generally a communication object between threads: one thread is doing the execution and writing to this object while one or more other threads are able to view the current state of the execution.

member.name: M:WebReports.Api.Execute.BaseExecution.#ctor
member.summary: This constructor should not be used, it's used for serialization purposes.

The export type for this execution

member.name: P:WebReports.Api.CrossTab.CrossTabData.CrossTab
member.summary: Retrieve the CrossTab that this data is associated with

member.name: P:WebReports.Api.CrossTab.CrossTabData.RootColumn
member.summary: Retrieve the root column header node for this data. The root node has no value, but have children which represent the data for the first column header. If there are two column headers, each child will have its own children (and so forth). This node should also be used in GetDataNode when the tabulation node required is the grand total column tabulation.

member.name: P:WebReports.Api.CrossTab.CrossTabData.RootRow
member.summary: Retrieve the root rowheader node for this data. The root node has no value, but have children which represent the data for the first row header. If there are two row headers, each child will have its own children (and so forth). This node should also be used in GetDataNode when the tabulation node required is the grand total row tabulation.

member.summary: Retrieve the data node which represents the data for the cross-tabulation of a row node and a column node. Providing a data header node at a level which is not the "end" node will result in a subtotal or grand total tabulation.

The column node for the data
member.returns: The data node, or null if no such data exists (there was no cross-related data).

member.summary: Retrieve the data node which represents the data for the cross-tabulation of a row node and a column node. If the node doesn't exist, it will be created if indicated so.
member.param: The first axis node for the data
The second axis node for the data
If there isn't a data node for this cross tabulation, one will be created
member.returns: The data node, or null if no such data exists (there was no cross-related data) and createIfNull is false.

member.name: M:WebReports.Api.CrossTab.CrossTabData.GetHeaderDictionary(WebReports.Api.CrossTab.CrossTabDataHeaderNode,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Retrieve the second level lookup dictionary which which represents the data for the first axis node specified. If the node doesn't exist, it will be created if indicated so.
member.param: The first axis node for the data
If there isn't a dictionary for this first level node, one will be created
member.returns: The second level lookup dictionary, or null if no such data exists (there was no data) and createIfNull is false.

member.summary: If true, all processing instructions in the compared documents/fragments will be ignored.

member.name: P:WebReports.Api.XmlDiffPatch.XmlDiff.IgnoreWhitespace
member.summary: If true, all whitespace nodes in the compared documents/fragments will be ignored. Also, all text nodes and values of attributes will be normalized; whitespace sequences will be replaced by single space and beginning and trailing whitespaces will be trimmed.

member.name: P:WebReports.Api.XmlDiffPatch.XmlDiff.IgnoreNamespaces
member.summary: If true, the namespaces will be ignored when comparing the names of elements and attributes. This also mean that the prefixes will be ignored too as if the IgnorePrefixes option is true.

member.name: P:WebReports.Api.XmlDiffPatch.XmlDiff.IgnorePrefixes
member.summary: If true, the prefixes will be ignored when comparing the names of elements and attributes. The namespaces will not ne ignored unless IgnoreNamespaces flag is true.

member.name: P:WebReports.Api.XmlDiffPatch.XmlDiff.IgnoreXmlDecl
member.summary: If true, the xml declarations will not be compared.

member.name: P:WebReports.Api.XmlDiffPatch.XmlDiff.IgnoreDtd
member.summary: If true, the xml declarations will not be compared.

member.name: P:WebReports.Api.XmlDiffPatch.XmlDiff.Options
member.summary: Options used when comparing xml documents/fragments.

member.name: P:WebReports.Api.XmlDiffPatch.XmlDiff.Algorithm
member.summary: Algorithm that will be used for XML comparison.

member.summary: Compares two XML documents or fragments.
member.param: The original xml document or fragment filename
The changed xml document or fragment filename.
If true, the passed files contain xml fragments; otherwise the files must contain xml documents.
member.returns: True, if the documents/fragments are identical.

member.name: M:WebReports.Api.XmlDiffPatch.XmlDiff.ParseOptions(System.String)
member.summary: Translates string representation of XmlDiff options into XmlDiffOptions enum.
member.param: Value of the 'options' attribute of the 'xd:xmldiff' element in diffgram.

member.name: M:WebReports.Api.XmlDiffPatch.XmlDiff.VerifySource(System.Xml.XmlNode,System.UInt64,WebReports.Api.XmlDiffPatch.XmlDiffOptions,System.UInt64@)
member.summary: Given a diffgram, this method verifies whether the given document/node is the original source document/node for the diffgram.
member.param: Document/node to be verified.
Value of the 'srcDocHash' attribute of the 'xd:xmldiff' element in diffgram. This is the hash value of the original source document. The document/node is verified if it yields the same hash value.
XmlDiff options selected when the document/node was compared. The hash value of the document/node depends on these options.
member.returns: True if the given document is the original source document for the diffgram.

member.name: F:InputSanitizer.extraHtmlEntities
member.summary: A list of HTML entities that HttpUtility.HtmlDecode will not decode

member.name: M:InputSanitizer.RemoveScriptAttacksSafe(System.String)
member.summary: Sanitizes the input text according to a blacklist of HTML tags and attributes. This method is considered a "safer choice" to RemoveScriptAttacksAggressive, which uses a whitelist and has more potential of transforming the input text

member.name: M:InputSanitizer.RemoveScriptAttacksAggressive(System.String)
member.summary: Sanitizes the input text according to a whitelist of HTML tags and a blacklist of attributes. This method is considered a "more dangerous" choice to RemoveScriptAttacksSafe which uses a blacklist instead of a whitelist.

member.name: M:InputSanitizer.DecodeDataUriString(System.String)
member.summary: returns a decoded string if the input text was a data uri of some sort

member.name: M:InputSanitizer.RemoveAttackStringsAggressive(System.String@)
member.summary: Performs the string sanitization, returning true if any attacks were removed

member.name: M:InputSanitizer.HtmlDecode(System.String)
member.summary: Call HtmlDecode on the provided string. Since HttpUtility.HtmlDecode will not decode certain HTML entities, so we will decode them manually.

member.name: M:InputSanitizer.RemoveExcelAttacks(System.String)
member.summary: EX-9924: Sanitizes a particular attack that KPMG reported that when opened in Excel, allows the user to be potentially phished into running an arbitrary system command.
